intro: Conostegia tunicata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or tunicate acanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy bracts that resemble leaves. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are usually pink or purple in color, adding ornamental value to gardens. Conostegia tunicata is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
